channel.title: NASA EDGE
channel.description: NASA EDGE. One NASA, Two Hosts, 20,000 plus Rocket Scientist. We have lift off. If you've ever wanted to learn about NASA but thought you needed to be a rocket scientist, wait no longer. Watch NASA EDGE and embrace your inner astronaut.
channel.itunes:keywords: NASA EDGE, Moon, Mars, shuttle, technology, Ares, Chris, Blair, station, national aeronautics and space administration, Spinoff, Lunar
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
channel.itunes:subtitle: An Inside and Outside Look at All Things NASA.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission X 2012
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Cumberland School in East London for Mission X 2012!

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS Propulsion
item.description: NASA EDGE looks at the development of the propulsion system for the Magnetospheric MultiScale Mission

item.title: NASA EDGE: Charlie Bolden
item.description: NASA EDGE Races to interview NASA Administrator Charlie Bolden.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2011 Recap
item.description: NASA EDGE combines recreation and research as they look back over 2011.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2011 Green Flight Challenge
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the Green Flight Challenge and witness an aviation first, true electric flight!

item.title: NE@MMS
item.description: Finally, NASA has a mission dedicated specifically to explore Magnetospherence - Magnetospheric MultiScale Mission.

item.title: NE@Orion Drop Test
item.description: NASA keeps the pool open all year round. Time for Orion to make a splash!

item.title: NE@DISCOVER-AQ
item.description: Aerosols can run, but they can't hide from DISCOVER-AQ's bevy of data gathering gizmos.

item.title: NE Live@STS-135
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the historic final launch of Space Shuttle Atlantis!

item.title: NE@X-HAB Competition
item.description: Interested in adding a second level to YOUR Habitat Demonstration Unit, check out the awesome designs. All Co-Host approved!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Innovative Technologies
item.description: Join NASA EDGE as they explore technologies currently being developed by NASA and their partners.

item.title: NE Live@Lunabotics Mining Competition 2011
item.description: Lunar Regolith Simulant flies as NASA EDGE covers the 2nd Annual Lunabotics Mining Competition!

item.title: NE Live@STS-134
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the 25th and final launch of Space Shuttle Endeavour!

item.title: NE@Mission X
item.description: NASA EDGE learns how Mission X helps kids around the world learn about fitness while training like an astronaut.

item.title: NE Live@Sun Earth Day 2011
item.description: NASA EDGE Celebrates Sun Earth Day 2011 with the Twitterazzi and our favorite solar scientists! SPF approved.

item.title: NE Live@Transit of Venus Promo
item.description: NASA EDGE promotes their live coverage for a major, unique and predictable astronomical event in 2012!

item.title: NE@Space Life Sciences Lab
item.description: NASA EDGE prepares for life in space by investigating space dust mitigation and interstellar gardening at NASA Kennedy's Space Life Sciences Lab.

item.title: NE@Radiation Belt Storm Probes
item.description: NASA EDGE investigates NASA's most ambitious look at the Earth's Radiation Belt to date: The Radiation Belt Storm Probes Mission.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2010 Recap
item.description: NASA EDGE looks back at the highlights of 2010 and makes a few key goals for the new year!

item.title: NE Live@A-Train
item.description: Jump on board NASA's A-Train, the premier constellation of Earth observing Satellites.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Hurricane GRIP
item.description: NASA EDGE gets a GRIP on tropical storms and hurricane development.

item.title: NE Live@D-RATS 2010
item.description: This year's D-RATS test features two rovers. And as everyone knows, twice the science equals twice the fun!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Future of Aeronautics
item.description: The Future of Aeronautics at NASA involves excellent in-flight and environmental upgrades... however, no drink coupons - not even for the Co-Host! [updated .mp4 file]

item.title: NASA EDGE: D-RATS 2010 Trailer
item.description: NASA EDGE will return to Black Point Lava Flow, AZ in September to cover D-RATS Live on the web.[updated .mp4 file]

item.title: NE@STORRM
item.description: It isn't exactly ISS valet service, but NASA STORRM should provide major docking improvements for future NASA space flight vehicles.[updated .mp4 file]

item.title: NASA EDGE: Extreme Analogs 2 NEEMO
item.description: NASA EDGE immerses themselves in another extreme analog, NEEMO. And yes, it is underwater.

item.title: NE Live@Lunabotics Mining Competition
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Astronaut Hall of Fame for NASA's 1st Annual Lunabotics Mining Competition.

item.title: NE Live@Orion Pad Abort 1 Flight Test
item.description: High winds didn't dampen the Orion team's enthusiasm or the success of the Orion Pad Abort 1 Flight Test at White Sands Missile Range, NM.

item.title: NE@Robonaut 2
item.description: Jacky and Franklin go behind the scenes with Robonaut2. They even learn the super secret Robonaut handshake.

item.title: NE Live@Sun-Earth Day 2010
item.description: Catch the Best of NASA EDGE Live from this year's culminating solar celebratory event, Sun-Earth Day 2010!

item.title: NE@Fahrenheit 6000
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with both NASA and ATK engineers about the Development Motor Test Firing in Promontory, Utah.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Launch Abort System
item.description: NASA EDGE previews the development of Orion’s Launch Abort System and discovers Chris’s fascination with smocks.

item.title: NE@Mercury Mission Control Room
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the brilliantly restored Mercury Mission Control Center exhibit at the Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex in Florida.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Extreme Analogs
item.description: NASA EDGE follows the Desert RATS around Black Point Lava Flow, AZ during the 14 day analog field test of the Lunar Electric Rover (LER)

item.title: NE@Ares IX Live Part 2
item.description: After multiple delays, Ares IX makes its historic flight live on NASA EDGE! [part 2]

item.title: NE@Ares IX Live Part 1
item.description: Chris, Blair, Franklin and Jacky cover the historic launch of Ares I-X! [part 1]

item.title: NE@Hometown Heroes
item.description: NASA EDGE joins Astronaut Mike Massimino and Twitter Phenomenon (Astro_Mike) as he returns home to the Big Apple to talk about STS-125.

item.title: NE@Apollo 40th After Party
item.description: NASA EDGE crashes the Apollo XI Anniversary celebration for a little after party rocket experience.

item.title: NE@SDO
item.description: It isn’t safe to stare at the Sun for you or the NASA EDGE Team, but SDO will be able to do just that with ease 24/7.

item.title: NE@Apollo XI 40th Anniversary
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates the 40th Apollo Anniversary by interviewing NASA Apollo Engineer Ed Kilgore

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Sims
item.description: Whether you’re working on Orion Feng Shui or docking with the ISS, NASA EDGE explores the latest in Orion Simulators at Lockheed Martin and NASA.

item.title: NE@Shuttle IR Imaging
item.description: Far from point and shoot, HYTHIRM’s Cast Glance Crew have turned shooting Infrared Images of the Shuttle into an art form.

item.title: NASA EDGE: STS-125
item.description: From Shuttle launch to breakthrough research during landings, NASA EDGE covers the latest, greatest mission to Hubble; STS-125!

item.title: NASA EDGE: LRO/LCROSS
item.description: NASA EDGE takes a close look at NASA’s first step in return to the Moon, LRO and LCROSS. Chris, Blair and Franklin interviews both teams and round out the show with a little Launch Services Program.

item.title: NE@Mission Madness Wrap-up
item.description: NASA EDGE announces the winners for the NASA 2009 Mission Madness Tournament.

item.title: NE@Ares I-X:Crew Module/Launch Abort System
item.description: Blair and Franklin take a quick look at the Crew Module and Launch Abort System for Ares I-X with Deputy Project Manager, Jonathan Cruz.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2009 NASA Mission Madness Vodcast
item.description: NASA EDGE presents the 2009 NASA Mission Madness Vodcast with special guests Miles O’Brien, Keith Cowing and Melvin Ferebee. Let the trash talking begin as we determine NASA’s greatest mission of all time.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Constellation
item.description: NASA EDGE heads to NASA Kennedy to take a look at several pieces and potential pieces of the Constellation program. Plus, viewer voice mail and Sten the Intern.

item.title: NE@SPR
item.description: Chris interviews the NASA team working on the Small Pressurized Rover. Blair goes everywhere except No-Cohost, AZ.

item.title: NE@Moses Lake
item.description: Chris, Blair and Franklin visit the regatta of regolith at Moses Lake, to check out NASA's latest lunar lineup.

item.title: NE@Lunar Robot Arm
item.description: It slices! It dices! Not really, but the Lunar Surface Manipulator System (LSMS), or NASA’s Lunar Robotic Arm as Blair likes to call it, is one potential workhorse for NASA’s permanent Lunar Outpost.

item.title: NE@Physics Day
item.description: NASA EDGE and a crack team of physicists from NASA Glenn Research Center visit Cedar Point Amusement Park to conduct Physics Experiments and track down Superheroes.

item.title: NE@eZLS
item.description: NASA EDGE does a few laps on the ISS, the moon and Mars with NASA Glenn Research Center’s Exercise Countermeasures Team.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Folklife Festival
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates NASA’s 50th Anniversary at the Smithsonian Folklife Festival in Washington, DC with interviews, an ESA and a unique lunar rover race.

item.title: NE@Lunar Hab
item.description: NASA EDGE visits one of NASA's lunar habitat concepts. Chris conducts an interview with Karen Whitley, while Blair conducts his own unique research.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Last Mission to Hubble
item.description: NASA EDGE features the Last Mission to Hubble with an Inside and Outside Hubble Quiz, an interview with a Hubble Engineer and insight from the STS-125 Crew.

item.title: NE@Experience Aviation
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Experience Aviation with Barrington Irving. Jacky interviews Barrington while Blair and Franklin try to compete in their flight simulators.

item.title: NE@Yuri's Night
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates Yuri Gagarin’s groundbreaking space flight with their friends at NASA Ames. Franklin introduces a new segment: Shuttle Bay Confessions.

item.title: NE@The Great Moonbuggy Race
item.description: NASA EDGE, along with 60 plus high school and college teams, braved the elements and the obstacles for NASA Marshall Space Flight Center’s Annual Great Moonbuggy Race.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Daytona 500
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates dual 50th's: NASA & and the Daytona 500. And we have interviews with NASCAR Driver Kurt Busch and NASA Astronauts Drew Feustel and Mike Good.

item.title: NE Live @ The Future Forum, en Espanol
item.description: NE Live @ The Future Forum, en Español

item.title: NE Live@The Future Forum
item.description: Blair takes the helm at NASA’s Future Forum. Can Franklin and Jacky bail him out?

item.title: NASA EDGE: Winter X 12
item.description: Whether you’re an Astronaut or an X Games Athlete, everyone needs a great support crew.

item.title: NE@The Orion FTA
item.description: NASA EDGE Gets an outside look at the Orion Flight Test Article. The Jury is out on the inside look.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 12: The 411 at NASA Dryden
item.description: This isn't your father's Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy; it's NASA Dryden's SOFIA and Ikhana projects... plus, special guests.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 11: Magnetospherence™
item.description: Sun-Earth Day 2008 Sol Man Troy Cline visits the NASA EDGE Studio to talk about Solar Week. Plus Blair revisits the Space Weather Action Center.

item.title: NE@The Space Shuttle Sim
item.description: Chris and Blair search for an alternate landing site while flying the Space Shuttle Sim.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 10: Lunar Architecture
item.description: Chris, Blair, and Franklin check out the lunar outpost floor plans, pick out wallpaper, and order a double-wide garage for SCOUT.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 9: X Games Los Angeles, CA
item.description: NASA EDGE crashes the X Games in Los Angeles, CA

item.title: NE@M113: The Space Shuttle Emergency Egress Vehicle
item.description: NASA EDGE puts the M113 through its paces!

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 8: Shuttle Launch - STS 118
item.description: Who says tailgating and Shuttle launching have nothing in common?

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 7: Road Trip, Part 2
item.description: Blair has 1,000 miles to figure out where to find a real Space Shuttle launch schedule... or else.

item.title: NE@The Moon Buggy Race
item.description: Driven by the maniacal Coach Blair and his diabolical equation for victory, Chris and NASA EDGE intern Brandon Endo gear up for The Moon Buggy Race.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 6: Road Trip, Part 1
item.description: Follow the NASA EDGE team as they take a road trip to NASA's Kennedy Space Center to see a space shuttle launch... maybe.

item.title: NE@The Gantry
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Langley gantry to watch a drop test of a potential Orion crew vehicle air bag landing system.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 5: NASA 101
item.description: Featuring: Geocaching, NASA 101

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 4: Sun-Earth Connection
item.description: Featuring: Blair turns geocaching into Man vs. Wild, news with Franklin, interviews with Dr. Nicky Fox and Troy Cline and the mighty mighty Space Weather Action Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 3: Winter X Games
item.description: Featuring: Winter X Games 11, Spinoff Technology, Space Food Cook-off, Mars, Ski Promo

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 2: Space Conference
item.description: Featuring: 2nd Space Exploration Conference, 21st Century Explorer Podcast Competition, ESA with Franklin

item.title: NASA EDGE Show 1: Exploration
item.description: Featuring: Medianaut Quarantine, ESA with Franklin, Pat Cosgrove interview.
